intro.description: Test that the help menu contains the correct contents and that each menu itemn works as expected.

item.title: Menu Entries
item.description:
Check that the help menu contains the following
Welcome
Help Contents
Search
Dynamic Help
Key Assist
Tips and Tricks
Cheat Sheets
Check for updates
Install new software
About Eclipse SDK

item.title: Welcome
item.description: Select Help/Welcome. verify that the Welcome screen shows and return to the workbench.

item.title: Help Contents
item.description: Select Help/Help Contents. Verify that the help contents open.

item.title: Search
item.description: Help/Search. Verify that the Help view shows with the Search Tab visible.

item.title: Dynamic Help
item.description: Help/Dynamic Help. Verify that the Help view is shown with the related topics page visible.

item.title: Cheat Sheets
item.description: Help/Cheat Sheets. Verify that the cheat sheet selection dialog opens.

item.title: Key Assist
item.description: Help/Key Assist. Verify that a table of key bindings is opened.

item.title: Tips and Tricks
item.description:
Help/Tips and Tricks. Verify that a small dialog shows three lines:
Eclipse Java Development Tools
Eclipse Platform
PDE

subitem.label: Help/About Eclipse SDK. Verify that an About dialog is shown which contains the Eclipse version number, logo and copyright information.

Press the Installation Details Button. Verify that a Dialog opens with five tabs - Installed Software, Installation History, Features, Plug-Ins, Configuration. Look at each tab to make sure that each one has content.
